_header: Lucina shining in silence of the night
_description: ‘The birth of Antichrist’ (or a Dream of Fortune) by William Dunbar — ten 5-line stanzas

CULLl510.First Lines:
Lucina schyning in scilience of þe nychtThe hevin all being
                    full of staris bricht…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Till þat twa mwnis war first sene in þe liftOr
                    quhill ane abbot flew aboue þe mone

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Lucina Schyning in silence of þe nychtThe hevyn all being full
                    of sterris bricht…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…quhill þat twa mwnis wer first sene in þe liftOr
                    quhill ane abbot flew abone þe moyne
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.405-7.

Banna.First Lines:
Lucina schynnyng in silence of the nichtThe hevin being all full of
                    sternis bricht…
Banna.Last Lines:
…quhill þat twa monis wer sene vp in the liftor quhill
                    ane abbot flew aboif þe mone
Banna.Attributed Title:
Ane vþer ballat following vpoun this same abbat In the 117 leif (f.
                    133)
